news.title: Bihar government to launch new programme for resolution of land disputes
news.para: Bihar's Revenue and Land Reforms Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha announced 'Bhumi Sudhar Samvad' on December 12 to resolve land disputes and update documents. A special 'Udan Dasta' team will combat land fraud, and a March campaign will target government land encroachment. Strict action is promised against corrupt officials and encroachers.

news.title: MPIDC gets consent for 300 hectare for Indore-Pithampur economic corridor
news.para: Landowners have given consent for nearly 300 hectares for the Indore-Pithampur Economic Corridor. This vital infrastructure project will connect Indore and Pithampur, a major industrial hub. The corridor aims to improve freight movement and reduce travel times. It is expected to attract new industrial investments. Efforts are underway to complete land pooling formalities.

news.title: Kochi: Infopark Phase III gets nodal officer for land pooling
news.para: Shaji V Nair has been appointed nodal officer for the land pooling process of Infopark's Phase III project, covering approximately 500 acres. This move aims to expedite the pooling of 300 acres in Kizhakkambalam panchayat for the integrated IT township.

news.title: HC sets aside Chandigarh housing board decision denying flats to jhuggi dwellers
news.para: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has overturned the Chandigarh Housing Board's rejection of jhuggi dwellers' claims for flats under the 2006 scheme. The court ruled the decision was made without a hearing, violating their right to be considered for housing. The administration must now re-evaluate their claims within two months.

news.title: EOU forms STF to crack down on sand, land mafias in Bihar
news.para: Bihar's Economic Offences Unit has formed a Special Task Force to combat illegal sand mining and land mafias. Led by DIG Manavjit Singh Dhillon, the team will investigate illicit assets, conduct financial probes, and seize properties. This initiative aims to ensure strict legal action against those amassing wealth through criminal activities.

news.title: Vadodara: Ruckus at town hall over PMAY house draw postponement
news.para: Beneficiaries of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) in Vadodara protested at the Sir Sayajirao Nagargruh town hall after draws for 2,700 houses were postponed by a day. Despite receiving postponement messages, some beneficiaries claimed they were unaware, leading to frustration and concerns about lost wages.

news.title: Residents accuse Ahmedabad civic body of delay in action against illegal building in society
news.para: Residents of Adhikar Co-operative Housing Society in Sabarmati have complained to the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation about an illegal five-storey building. The structure, intended for paying-guest accommodation, was built without approvals. Despite repeated complaints over 18 months and AMC issuing notices and sealing the site, construction continued. Residents allege builder influence is causing the inaction. The building is now complete.

news.title: Ghaziabad: Real estate rates soar in Indirapuram, but civic infrastructure shambolic
news.para: Indirapuram, once a sought-after NCR locality, now faces civic neglect despite rising premium real estate prices. Residents lament dug-up roads, dust, and severe traffic congestion, turning the township into an unlivable space. The stark contrast between luxury housing and collapsing infrastructure highlights a growing concern for its inhabitants.

news.title: Hyderabad: ED searches Bhuvan Teza Infra in pre-launch flat scam probe
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate searched six locations connected to Bhuvan Teza Infra Projects Private Ltd. This action is part of a money laundering investigation into a pre-launch flat scam. Bhuvan Teza Infra director Chekka Venkata Subrahmanyam allegedly collected crores from buyers for Happy Homes flats. The company neither handed over the units nor returned the money.

news.title: Karnataka government to open bids for IT Park project in Mangaluru next week
news.para: Karnataka will open bids on December 15 for a new IT Park in Mangaluru. This project, costing Rs 135 crore, is part of the state's 'Beyond Bengaluru' initiative. The government aims to boost IT and BT investments across various regions. Selected bidders will get government land on a 30-year lease.

news.title: CHD Vann gets control to complete Gurugram project delayed by 11 years after NCLT nod
news.para: The National Company Law Tribunal has approved the separation of CHD Vann from CHD Developers' insolvency proceedings. This allows landowners Roots Developers to take control and complete the stalled housing project. The decision follows a proposal supported by the committee of creditors and a settlement with Edelweiss ARC, offering hope to homebuyers facing years of delay.

news.title: Government to probe extremely low bids for repair of cessed South Mumbai buildings
news.para: The Maharashtra government has ordered an inquiry into tenders for Mumbai's dilapidated buildings that quoted significantly below estimated prices, following allegations of irregularities and illegal construction. Congress MLA Amin Patel highlighted concerns about contractors minting money by adding illegal floors.

news.title: Mumbai: MHADA invites online tenders for 16 amenity plots
news.para: Mumbai's housing authority has re-tendered 16 amenity plots across various city locations after the initial bid received no response. These plots, ranging in size, are designated for essential facilities like schools, hospitals, markets, and community centers, with a deadline for submissions set for January 16.

news.title: Ahmedabad elevated to higher-risk quake zone; realty braces for 25% cost shock
news.para: Ahmedabad has been upgraded to Seismic Zone IV by the Bureau of Indian Standards, effective May 3, 2026. This change mandates stronger structural designs for new buildings, requiring increased material usage. Industry experts anticipate a 20-25% rise in new property prices due to these enhanced construction standards.

news.title: Hyderabad: Auro Realty acquires Taj Banjara for ₹315 crore
news.para: Aurobindo Group's realty arm, Auro Realty, has acquired the iconic Taj Banjara hotel in Hyderabad for ₹315 crore. The deal marks the end of operations for one of the city's first five-star hotels, which has been closed since its lease expired in 2023.

news.title: Uttarakhand cabinet okays proposal for resort building on farmland without land use change
news.para: The Uttarakhand cabinet has taken significant steps towards enhancing the tourism sector by approving agricultural land for resort development without altering its designated use. The new regulations stipulate that roads in hilly areas must be at least six meters wide, while those in plains should be nine meters.

news.title: Jammu & Kashmir RERA proposes single window system for integrated approvals
news.para: In a bid to streamline real estate processes, the Jammu and Kashmir Real Estate Regulatory Authority is introducing a consolidated single window system for project approvals and registrations. Accompanying this initiative are district-level enforcement teams tasked with monitoring compliance and rectifying any violations.

news.title: JSW Paints acquires 61.2% stake in Akzo Nobel India
news.para: JSW Paints has acquired a 61.2% stake in Akzo Nobel India, marking one of the largest deals in the paints sector and strengthening its position in decorative and industrial coatings.

news.title: Pune land deal: Is police protecting deputy CM's son Parth Pawar? asks Bombay HC
news.para: The Bombay High Court has raised significant concerns regarding the police investigation into a high-stakes land deal in Pune, indicating possible favoritism towards Parth Pawar, the son of Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar. The transaction, involving 40 acres of land sold for an astonishing Rs 300 crore, has drawn scrutiny since the land was allegedly government-owned and not for sale.
